questions.question: What is the first step in preparing data for machine learning?

explanations.b: Correct! Preprocessing is the first step before training a model.
explanations.c: Predictions happen after training the model.

questions.question: Which method is commonly used to identify missing values in a dataset?

explanations.a: describe() summarizes numerical statistics, not missing values.
explanations.c: Correct! It shows how many missing values exist in each column.

questions.question: Which technique is used to handle extreme outliers?

explanations.a: This is used for categorical encoding.
explanations.b: Correct! IQR helps detect and remove outliers.
explanations.c: Normalization scales features but doesn't detect outliers.
explanations.d: Forward fill is used for missing values, not outliers.

questions.question: Which encoding method is best for nominal categorical variables?

explanations.a: Ordinal encoding is used when categories have order.
explanations.b: Correct! One-hot encoding is ideal for unordered categories.
explanations.c: Z-score scaling is for feature scaling.

questions.question: Which technique is widely used for handling imbalanced datasets?

explanations.b: Correct! SMOTE generates synthetic samples for the minority class.
explanations.c: Dropping columns does not fix imbalance.
